Key Match Events: Aiden Markram's running catch to dismiss Harry Brook in the final over effectively sealed the win for South Africa.
Harry Brook's 37-ball 53 hauled England to within touching distance of the target, but they fell short by seven runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed disappointment at England's inability to match South Africa's intensity in the powerplay.
Buttler highlighted Quinton de Kock's 38-ball 65 as the difference in the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a slow surface in the scorching daytime heat.
Quinton de Kock's 21-ball half-century was a key moment in South Africa's innings.
Others: England's defeat means they will have to wait until Sunday to secure their place in the semi-finals, depending on the result of the West Indies vs South Africa match.
Others (continued): Jofra Archer's 12th over, which cost three runs but saw the uppercut fly into Buttler's glove, was a turning point in the match.
